version_description:
What's new in 3.2.0

• Facebook users can now use Facebook Login to register and login to FlightView
• Post your Flight or the Flights within a Trip to your iPhone Calendar
• 7-Day Weather forecast so you can see the weather forecast for both ends of your trip
• The Scheduled Duration of a flight is now shown in Flight Details, making it easier to tell how long is a cross-timezone flight
• Codeshares can now optionally be filtered out so that only Operating flights show in flight search results
• For Flight Tracking forms, the button to search for an Airline or Airport code is more prominent and easier to tap
• Bug fixes and other small enhancements

Thank you for using the FlightView app, and all of the positive response to our 3.x releases!

What's new in earlier 3.x releases:

• iOS 7 look and feel
• (BETA) Forward your itinerary confirmation email to Trips@FlightView.com, and it will be automatically loaded into your My Trips on your device
• Trips are synced between devices and with www.FlightView.com so you can quickly reference their statuses everywhere
• Look up flights up to 350 days in the future (prior release limit was 180 days)
• See recently selected Airports when searching for an Airport
• See recently selected Airlines when searching for an Airline


We appreciate the continued great response and support you have given the FlightView app. If you would like to give us a great review, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the FlightView app. There you can press the "Rate App" button, and it will take you to our App within the app store, where you can tap "Reviews" and then the blue "Write a Review" link.

If you have had a problem with the FlightView app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@FlightView.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

What's new in 3.1.1

Thank you for using the FlightView app, and all of the positive response to our 3.0 release!

• Bug fixes


What's new in 3.1.0

• iOS 7 enhancements
• See recently selected Airports when searching for an Airport
• See recently selected Airlines when searching for an Airline
• Choose 'Arrival' or 'Departure' when selecting a date for a flight search. This will help when searching for an In Air flight that is flying across the dateline and departed 'two days' ago.
• Other improvements and bug fixes


What's new in 3.0.1

• Facebook users can again post their flight information to their wall. Some users in 3.0.0 were not able to post.
• Fixed an issue that could occur with setting a trip end date in the last weeks of December.
• Other improvements and bug fixes


What's new in 3.0.0

We have been working very hard to make FlightView the most useful flight tracking app! In this release, we are launching the ability for you to synchronize your trips across devices as well as forward your itinerary email confirmations to Trips@FlightView.com for automatic loading into your Trips. These capabilities have been the most requested features by our users, and we are excited to make them available to you! In addition, we have also been expanding our flight coverage, and we now track flights throughout the world, so wherever you fly, FlightView can be there to help.

• (BETA) Forward your itinerary confirmation email to Trips@FlightView.com, and it will be automatically loaded into your My Trips on your device
• Trips are synced between devices and with www.FlightView.com so you can quickly reference their statuses everywhere
• Look up flights up to 350 days in the future (prior release limit was 180 days)

• Voice-over users will find the original standard date picker that works with the iPhone Voice-over feature.
• Other improvements and bug fixes

We appreciate the continued great response and support you have given the FlightView app. If you would like to give us a great review, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the FlightView app. There you can press the "Rate App" button, and it will take you to the review link within the app store.

If you have had a problem with the FlightView app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@FlightView.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

What's new in 3.3.2
• Fixes an issue using the app on iOS 5.1.1

What's new in 3.3.0
• We are excited to offer our FlightView app in the UK and we hope you find it useful in your travels!
• We welcome your feedback and look forward to hearing from you.
• You can choose between Imperial and Metric units of measure.


We appreciate the continued great response and support our users have given the FlightView app. If you would like to give us a great review, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the FlightView app. There you can press the "Rate App" button, and it will take you to our App within the app store, where you can tap "Reviews" and then the blue "Write a Review" link.

If you have had a problem with the FlightView app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@FlightView.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

3.4.1 Fixes a bug that prevented Aircraft's Previous Flight from working properly

What's new in 3.4.0

• See My Next Trip information in the FlightView iOS8 'Today' widget.
- Turn on your My Next Trip widget by pulling down the 'Today' view, scrolling to the bottom and tapping the 'Edit' button
- Access the details of your next trip in the 'Today' view by tapping a flight
• Updated various app images
• Other bug fixes

What's new in 3.3.0
• We are excited to offer our FlightView app in the UK and we hope you find it useful in your travels!
• We welcome your feedback and look forward to hearing from you.
• You can choose between Imperial and Metric units of measure.


We appreciate the continued great response and support our users have given the FlightView app. If you would like to give us a great review, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the FlightView app. There you can press the "Rate App" button, and it will take you to our App within the app store, where you can tap "Reviews" and then the blue "Write a Review" link.

If you have had a problem with the FlightView app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@FlightView.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

• Supports iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus native screen sizes
• Code for easyJet will now appear as EZY, code for Thomson Airways will now appear as TOM
• Works with the latest Facebook login
• The Log In and Sign Up functions are easier to find directly under "Options"
• Other bug fixes


We appreciate the continued great response and support you have given the FlightView app. If you would like to give us a great review or recommend the app to a friend, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the FlightView app. To review the app, tap the "Rate App" button to visit our app at the App Store, where you can tap "Reviews" and then tap the blue "Write a Review" link. To tell your friends about the app, tap the "Recommend to a Friend" button.

If you have had a problem with the FlightView app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@FlightView.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

• New branding since FlightView is now part of OAG
• Better handling of iOS9 display screens
• Other bug fixes

We appreciate the continued great response and support you have given the FlightView app. If you would like to give us a great review or recommend the app to a friend, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the FlightView app. To review the app, tap the "Rate App" button to visit our app at the App Store, where you can tap "Reviews" and then tap the blue "Write a Review" link. To tell your friends about the app, tap the "Recommend to a Friend" button.

If you have had a problem with the FlightView app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@FlightView.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

FlightView free now just called Flightview. The app is the same, we just made the name shorter!
Bug Fixes
• Fixed issue where users would be logged out of their Flightview account without them realizing
• "Like this App?" is now visible again in Options
• Other bug fixes


We appreciate the continued great response and support you have given the Flightview app. If you would like to give us a great review or recommend the app to a friend, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the Flightview app.

If you have had a problem with the Flightview app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@Flightview.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"

Bug Fixes
• Fixed issue with saving a flight to the calendar
• Other bug fixes


We appreciate the continued great response and support you have given the Flightview app. If you would like to give us a great review or recommend the app to a friend, check out our "Like This App?" section under "Options" within the Flightview app.

If you have had a problem with the Flightview app, or would like to request enhancements, please send us email at iPhoneAppSupport@Flightview.com. You can also start that email by tapping the "Send Feedback" button in the "Like This App?" section under "Options"
• Bug fixes

Hello all flightview users, we are making big changes and improvements to the flightview app over the coming months. Keep your eyes peeled for incoming updates.

- We resolved an issue with push notifications not appearing on some devices with firmware iOS13+.
- Added an often requested feature, quick airport switch button when finding a flight by route.
- Added a sign-up and login page to the home screen, use your account across multiple devices and ensure that you do not lose your flights when you have issues with your app or device.
- Updated background image, to improve readability.
- Other minor bug fixes and wording changes.
- Fixed font change.

Hello flightview users, we're working hard on making it easier to track, share and manage your flights.
- We've made changes to the app to improve usability and readability
- Simplified the sign up process, we recommend you sign up for an account to keep your trips and flights safe.
- We now support Dark mode on devices with iOS13+ Many of you have been waiting for this, you can change this on your devices Display & Brightness setting.
- We've made it easier to create an account
- Other minor bug fixes and tweaks

Hello flightview users, just a small update this time around:
- Fixed bug with some Scheduled flights appearing in red
- Fixed bug in the sign-up screen

Hello flightviewers, we've added a new feature we hope you love and a number of changes and bug fixes:
- We've added Arrival and Departure information for all available airports, you can access this new feature via your Home page or selecting an airport via the airport screen.
- For users on iOS13, you are now able to set Dark/Light theme via the setting menu. This was previously auto-set based on your phone settings.
- Improved color contrast on certain screens
- Made a number of error messages more actionable when you encounter a problem.
- Other minor bug and text fixes

Hello flightviewers, we've added a new feature we hope you love and a number of changes and bug fixes:
- We've added Arrival and Departure information for all available airports, you can access this new feature via your Home page or selecting an airport via the airport screen.
- For users on iOS13, you are now able to set Dark/Light theme via the setting menu. This was previously auto-set based on your phone settings.
- Improved color contrast on certain screens
- Made a number of error messages more actionable when you encounter a problem.
- Other minor bug and text fixes

Hi flightviewers, another update for you here, info below:

- Apple login now available
- We've provided the option to remove ads, you can access this via the settings menu at any time. This is completely optional.
- For our users in California, we have added legal link in our about flightview page in settings.
- We've added a few more tutorials to make it easier for you to create trips and save flights.
- Improved error messaging to ensure you're better informed when things go wrong
- Added share text to make it more visible, save time by messaging friends and family directly through the app or where available you can add them directly to your calendar.
There's a sneaky bug causing the app to crash when tracking flights, we've attempted a fix but will continue to monitor the situation.

Hello flightviewers,

Looks like our previous fix didn't do the trick, here's another update to hopefully resolve the crash that some of you are seeing. Thank you for your patience.

The flightview team

Hello flightviewers,

Many of you were upset that the ability to change your trip dates had disappeared, our developers have worked their magic and it has now reappeared. Hopefully, this hasn't caused you too many issues.

- There was a bug that caused the subscription popup appear more than expected, we have now fixed this.
- Added a number of filter options on the Trips screen to give you more control over what you see.
- Added a partners to options, fairly empty at the moment but we’ll add to this in future releases.
- Resolved a number bugs and crashes

We've resolved an issue with the Track by Flight screen that was blocking users from searching and saving.

This should now be resolved, please get in touch with support if this remains an issue.

Thank you,
The flightview team
- Fixed a number of user reported bugs
